Quick Note: Manage users, groups, roles, and permissions; enforce least privilege and secure access to AWS resources.
Launch virtual servers (“instances”) in the cloud, providing scalable compute capacity.
Persistent block-level storage volumes for use with EC2 instances; data persists even after instance termination.
Scalable, elastic, shared file storage for Linux instances, accessible across multiple AZs.
Family of fully-managed third-party file systems (e.g., Windows File Server, Lustre, NetApp ONTAP) for specialized workloads.
Distribute traffic across multiple EC2 instances (or containers); improves fault tolerance and scalability.
Automatically adjusts the number of EC2 instances to handle variable workloads while minimizing cost.
“Infinite” object storage; store and retrieve large amounts of data, with multiple storage classes for different use cases.
Physical devices for data migration (petabyte-scale) and edge computing when network transfer is slow, limited, or offline.
Hybrid storage service bridging on-premises data and the AWS cloud; provides file, volume, or tape-based integration with S3.
Managed relational database service (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, Oracle, SQL Server) with automatic patching, backups, and scaling options.
High-performance, highly scalable, and fully managed relational database compatible with MySQL and PostgreSQL; offers better throughput than standard RDS engines.
Managed in-memory data stores (Redis or Memcached) to boost performance by caching frequently accessed data.
Fully managed, serverless NoSQL key-value database; scales to massive workloads with high performance.
Managed, petabyte-scale data warehouse solution for online analytical processing (OLAP).
Managed big data framework (Hadoop, Spark, etc.) to process vast amounts of data quickly at scale on EC2 clusters.
Serverless service to run SQL queries on data stored in S3; pay only for scanned data.
Business intelligence (BI) service for building interactive dashboards and visualizations, powered by serverless architecture.
Managed, scalable document database compatible with MongoDB; stores JSON-like documents.
Managed, highly available graph database, ideal for applications working with heavily interconnected data (e.g., social networks).
Serverless time-series database for IoT or operational data; designed for efficient real-time and historical data analysis.
Immutable, cryptographically verifiable ledger service for tracking changes in data over time, often used for financial transactions.
Managed service to create and manage scalable blockchain networks, supporting Ethereum or Hyperledger Fabric.
Serverless data integration (ETL) service to discover, prepare, combine, and move data for analytics.
Migrates databases (homogeneous or heterogeneous) to AWS with minimal downtime; supports continuous replication.
Orchestrate and run Docker containers on a cluster of EC2 instances or on AWS Fargate.
Serverless compute engine for containers; run Docker containers without managing EC2 instances.
Private container image registry for storing Docker images; integrated with ECS and Fargate.
Managed Kubernetes control plane to run containerized applications using Kubernetes on AWS.
Serverless Function as a Service (FaaS) platform for running code on-demand without managing servers; scales automatically.
Managed service for creating, publishing, and managing REST or WebSocket APIs; can front AWS Lambda or other back ends.
Fully managed batch processing service that can dynamically launch compute resources for batch jobs.
Simplified compute, networking, and storage aimed at small applications, websites, and dev/test environments with predictable monthly pricing.
Infrastructure as code; model and provision AWS resources using JSON/YAML templates.
Automate code deployments to EC2 instances, on-prem servers, or Lambda; manages rolling updates and rollback.
Unified interface to view operational data from multiple AWS services; run commands, patch fleets, store parameters, and automate tasks at scale.
(Legacy service, now deprecated for new customers) Hosted Git-based repositories for private source control in AWS.
Managed build service to compile source code, run tests, and produce deployable artifacts.
Continuous integration & continuous delivery (CI/CD) orchestration service to automate code release pipelines.
Secure, scalable artifact management (package repository) for Maven, Gradle, npm, Python, NuGet, etc.
Define AWS infrastructure in familiar programming languages (TypeScript, Python, etc.); outputs CloudFormation templates.
Monitoring service for AWS; collects metrics, logs, alarms, events, and more for resources and applications.
Records API calls and account activity across AWS; used for auditing changes and detecting unauthorized access.
Traces and visualizes requests in distributed applications, helping pinpoint performance issues and bottlenecks.
ML-powered service providing automated code reviews (Reviewer) and application performance analysis (Profiler).
Shows overall AWS service status (by region), historical service uptime, and outages.
Personalized view of events and scheduled activities that affect your specific AWS resources.
Brings AWS services into your own data center with fully managed “Outposts Racks;” ideal for hybrid requirements and low-latency edge use cases.
Places AWS compute/storage inside telecom providers’ 5G networks for ultra-low-latency applications.
Run select AWS services close to large population centers for lower latency (subset of region resources in a “local zone”).
Highly available and scalable DNS web service; can route traffic based on latency, geolocation, etc.
Global content delivery network (CDN) caching content at Edge Locations for low-latency delivery.
Improves application availability and performance by routing traffic through the AWS global network; provides static IP addresses.
Speeds up uploads/downloads to/from S3 by routing data through AWS Edge Locations.
Isolated, virtual network for AWS resources; define subnets, route tables, and gateways for controlling traffic.
Logical partitions in a VPC; each subnet resides in a single Availability Zone (public or private).
Allows resources in public subnets to access the public internet (and vice versa).
Provides outbound internet access for instances in private subnets while keeping them inaccessible from the internet.
Stateful firewalls at instance-level that allow inbound/ outbound rules; no “deny” rules.
Subnet-level stateless firewall allowing/denying specific IP traffic in and out.
Capture and log all IP traffic in VPC or subnets for auditing and troubleshooting.
Directly connect two VPCs privately through AWS internal network; not transitive.
Privately connect to AWS services without using an IGW or NAT; traffic stays within AWS.
Encrypt traffic between on-prem data centers and AWS; uses public internet.
Dedicated, private, high-speed link from on-prem to AWS data centers; bypasses public internet.
Central hub to interconnect thousands of VPCs and on-prem networks, simplifying complex networking.
DDoS protection service at Layer 3/4; Standard is free; Advanced includes 24/7 support and cost protection.
Layer 7 firewall; define custom rules to block/allow traffic to ALB, API Gateway, or CloudFront.
Protect VPCs at scale with advanced network traffic filtering (stateful inspection, intrusion detection, etc.).
Centrally configure and manage firewall rules across accounts and resources (WAF, Shield Advanced, etc.) in an Organization.
Create, store, and manage cryptographic keys used for encryption across AWS services.
Dedicated, hardware-based security module where you control keys entirely (FIPS 140-2 Level 3).
Provision, manage, and deploy TLS/SSL certificates on AWS resources (e.g. ALB, CloudFront); free for public certificates.
Rotate, manage, and retrieve database/app secrets (usernames, passwords, etc.) with built-in rotation for some RDS engines.
Central resource for compliance-related information, security and compliance documents (SOC, PCI, ISO reports).
ML-powered threat detection service to identify unauthorized or malicious activity via logs (VPC Flow Logs, DNS Logs, CloudTrail).
Automated security assessment service scanning for vulnerabilities or network exposure on EC2 instances, ECR container images, and Lambda functions.
Track and audit configuration changes in AWS resources; evaluate compliance against desired configurations.
Discover and protect sensitive data in S3 (e.g. PII); uses ML-based pattern matching.
Centralized security view, aggregates alerts (“findings”) from multiple services (GuardDuty, Inspector, Macie, etc.).
Analyze, investigate, and quickly identify root causes of security issues or suspicious activities using machine learning.
Identifies resources in your account (e.g., S3 buckets, IAM roles) that are shared externally; ensures no unintended external access.
Captures streaming data and delivers it automatically to storage or analytics endpoints such as S3, Redshift, and OpenSearch.
Managed message queue for decoupling or buffering tasks between microservices, distributed systems, and serverless apps.
Publish-subscribe messaging; push messages to multiple subscribers (SQS, Lambda, HTTP endpoints, email, SMS).
Managed message broker (ActiveMQ, RabbitMQ) to migrate existing on-prem or open-protocol workloads that rely on standard messaging APIs.
ML-powered image/video recognition; detect objects, faces, text, moderation, etc.
Converts audio to text using automatic speech recognition (ASR).
Text-to-speech service that turns text into lifelike spoken audio.
Machine translation service for translating large amounts of text among numerous supported languages.
Build conversational interfaces (chatbots) with voice and text powered by same technology as Alexa.
Managed cloud contact center solution with AI features (Lex integration) for routing, analytics, call flows.
NLP service to identify text language, sentiment, key phrases, and topics from documents or text data.
Fully managed platform for data scientists and developers to build, train, and deploy ML models at scale.
ML-powered enterprise search; lets you index and search across various document repositories.
Real-time personalization and recommendation service using machine learning (similar technology to Amazon.com’s personalization).
Extracts text and data (including from forms/tables) from scanned documents using machine learning.
Manage multiple AWS accounts (centralized billing, consolidated usage, service control policies, etc.).
Simplifies setting up and governing multi-account environments; automates best-practices creation of accounts, guardrails, etc.
Securely share AWS resources (e.g., Subnets, Transit Gateways, Aurora DB) with other AWS accounts or Organization OUs.
Create catalogs of approved products (CloudFormation-based) so end-users can self-provision in a compliant/consistent way.
